00047     template<typename T, Integer _lo=0, Integer _hi=-1> class Bag :
00048                 public std::multiset<T>, public Aggregate
00049     {
00050     public:
00051 
00052         typedef typename std::multiset<T>::iterator iterator;
00053         typedef typename std::multiset<T>::const_iterator const_iterator;
00054         typedef typename std::multiset<T>::reverse_iterator reverse_iterator;
00055         typedef typename std::multiset<T>::const_reverse_iterator
00056         const_reverse_iterator;
00057 
00058         Bag(bool unset=false) :
00059                 Aggregate(unset)
00060         {
00061         }
00062 
00063         Bag(const T value[], Integer count) throw(std::range_error)
00064         {
00065             if (count<_lo)
00066                 throw std::range_error("Bag : array not big enough");
00067             if (_hi>0)
00068                 if (count>=_hi)
00069                     throw std::range_error("Bag size is not big enough for the array");
00070 
00071             for (Integer i=0; i<count; ++i)
00072                 insert(value[i]);
00073         }
00074 
00075         Bag(const std::vector<T>& value) throw(std::range_error)
00076         {
00077             if (Integer(value.size())<_lo)
00078                 throw std::range_error("Bag : vector not big enough");
00079             if (_hi>0)
00080                 if (Integer(value.size())>=_hi)
00081                     throw std::range_error("Bag size is not big enough for the vector");
00082 
00083             for (unsigned i=0;i<value.size();++i)
00084                 insert(value[i]);
00085         }
00086 
00087 #ifndef GLIBCXX_HAS_DEFECTS
00088         Bag(const std::list<T>& value) throw(std::range_error)
00089         {
00090             if (Integer(value.size())<_lo)
00091                 throw std::range_error("Bag : list not big enough");
00092             if (_hi>0)
00093                 if (Integer(value.size())>=_hi)
00094                     throw std::range_error("Bag size is not big enough for the list");
00095 
00096             std::copy(value.begin(),value.end(),this->begin());
00097         }
00098 #endif
00099         virtual ~Bag()
00100         {
00101         }
00102 
00103         virtual void insert(const T& _val = getUnset(T()))
00104         throw( std::out_of_range)
00105         {
00106             if (_hi>0)
00107                 if (Integer(std::multiset<T>::size())==_hi)
00108                     throw std::out_of_range("Bag is full");
00109 
00110             std::multiset<T>::insert(_val);
00111             setUnset(false);
00112         }
00113 
00114         virtual void erase(iterator &it)
00115         {
00116             std::multiset<T>::erase(it);
00117         }
00118 
00119         virtual void erase(const T &value)
00120         {
00121             std::multiset<T>::erase(value);
00122         }
00123 
00124         virtual inline Integer getUpperBound()
00125         {
00126             if (_hi>0)
00127                 return _hi;
00128             else
00129                 return getUnset(_hi);
00130         }
00131         virtual inline Integer getLowerBound()
00132         {
00133             return _lo;
00134         }
00135 
00136         void operator=(const Bag<T,_lo,_hi>&other)
00137         {
00138             this->setUnset(other.isUnset());
00139             std::multiset<T>::operator=(other);
00140         }
00141     private:
00142         // cannot allow to have an operator that will allow different sizes of List to be assigned
00143         std::multiset<T>& operator=(const std::multiset<T>& other);
00144 
00145     };

00148     template<typename T,Integer _lo, Integer _hi> inline Bag<T,_lo,_hi>& getUnset(Bag<T,_lo,_hi>)
00149     {
00150         static Bag<T,_lo,_hi> unset(true);
00151         return unset;
